name: Baryta  carb
Relationship: Compare: Digitalis; Radium; Aragallus; Oxtrop; Astrag. Complementary: Dulc.; Silica; Psorin. Incompatible: Calc. Antidote for poisonous doses: Epsom salts.

Head: Hair falls out
Confusion
Brain feels as if loose
Vertigo; stitches, when standing in the sun, extending through head
WENS
Stomach: Pain and weight immediately after a meal, with epigastric tenderness
Water brash, hiccough, and eructation, which relieves pressure as of a stone
Gastric weakness in the aged with possible malignancy present
Abdomen: Habitual colic, with hunger, but food is refused
Mouth: Smarting, burning pain in tip of tongue
Spasms of oesophagus when food enters
Mouth filled with inflamed vesicles, foul taste
Rectum: Every time patient urinates, his piles come down
Respiratory: Dry, suffocative cough, especially in old people, full of mucus but lacking strength to expectorate, worse every change of weather
Larynx feels as if smoke were inhaled
Eyes: Alternate dilatation and contraction of pupils
Face: Pale, puffed; sensation as of cobweb
Nose: Dry; sneezing, CORYZA, WITH SWELLING OF UPPER LIP AND NOSE
Ears: GLANDS AROUND EARS PAINFUL AND SWOLLEN
Heart: Palpitation and distress in region of heart
Accelerates the heart's action at first, blood pressure much increased, contraction of blood vessels
Palpitation when lying on left side, when thinking of it especially; pulse full and hard
Modalities: Worse: while thinking of symptoms; from washing; lying on painful side
Back: SWOLLEN GLANDS IN NAPE OF OCCIPUT
Sleep: Talking in sleep; awakens frequently; feels too hot
Female: Before menses, pain in stomach and small of back
Throat: Smarting pain when swallowing; worse empty swallowing
Spasm of oesophagus as soon as food enters oesophagus, causes gagging and choking
TAKES COLD EASILY, WITH STITCHES AND SMARTING PAIN
Feeling of a plug in pharynx
Throat troubles from over use of voice
Stinging pain in tonsils, pharynx or larynx
Extremities: Toes and soles sore; soles painful when walking
Numb feeling from knees to scrotum; disappears when sitting down
Pain in joints; burning pains in lower limbs

details: Specially indicated in INFANCY and OLD AGE. This remedy brings aid to scrofulous children, especially if they are backward mentally and physically, are dwarfish, do not grow and develop, have scrofulous ophthalmia, swollen abdomen, take cold easily, and then ALWAYS HAVE SWOLLEN TONSILS. Persons subject to quinsy, which is prone to suppurate; gums bleed easily. Diseases of old men when degenerative changes begin; - cardiac vascular and cerebral; - who have hypertrophied prostate or indurated testes, very sensitive to cold, offensive foot-sweats, very weak and weary, must sit or lie down or lean on something. Very averse to meeting strangers. Catarrh of posterior nares, with frequent epistaxis. Often useful in the dyspepsia of the young who have masturbated and who suffer from seminal emissions, together with cardiac irritability and palpitation. Affects glandular structures, and useful in general degenerative changes, especially in coats of arteries, ANEURISM, and senility. Baryta is a cardiovascular poison acting on the muscular coats of heart and vessels. Arterial fibrosis. Blood-vessels soften and degenerate, become distended, and aneurisms, ruptures, and apoplexies result.
dosage: Third to thirtieth potency, the latter to remove the predisposition to quinsy. Baryta is slow in action, bears repetition.
